definition: lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
desire/appetite/passion/lust/greed
fast/rapid/quick/velocity
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Da
to attain/to reach/to amount to/to communicate/eminent

sentences.english: Remember the old saw, haste makes waste.
You must constantly bear in mind that haste makes waste.
sentences.chinese: 你须将“欲速则不达”一语常记心中。

sentences.english: 'More haste, less speed' is a paradox.
sentences.chinese: “欲速则不达”是似非而是的隽语。

definition: lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/also written 欲速則不達|欲速则不达
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: hasty men don't get to eat hot tofu (idiom)/one just has to be patient/haste will ruin everything
pinyin: xin1 ji2 chi1 bu5 liao3 re4 dou4 fu5

definition: take your time/take it easy
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom)/fig. time invested in preparations is not lost/a beard well lathered is half shaved
pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1

definition: to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)
to produce the opposite of the desired result
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
easy to grasp but difficult to put into practice (idiom)/easier said than done
